Title: $\lim\limits_{n \to{+}\infty}{\sqrt[n]{n!}}$ is infinite
Content: How do I prove that $ \displaystyle\lim_{n \to{+}\infty}{\sqrt[n]{n!}}$ is infinite?
AcceptedAnswer: By considering Taylor series, $\displaystyle e^x \geq \frac{x^n}{n!}$ for all $x\geq 0,$ and $n\in \mathbb{N}.$ In particular, for $x=n$ this yields $$ n! \geq \left( \frac{n}{e} \right)^n .$$ Thus $$\sqrt[n]{n!} \geq \frac{n}{e} \to \infty.$$
